flaw_data.description: Knee bend too deep, wasting energy
flaw_data.plain_language: You're bending your knees too much. This wastes energy and can make your shot inconsistent.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Don't over-bend your knees. Find a comfortable athletic stance that you can repeat consistently.
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Mirror work: Practice your shooting stance in front of a mirror to find optimal knee bend.

flaw_data.description: Shooting elbow positioned too far from body
flaw_data.plain_language: Your shooting elbow is sticking out too far from your body. This reduces accuracy and consistency.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Wall shooting drill: Stand arm's length from a wall and practice your shooting motion without hitting the wall.

flaw_data.description: Shot timing could be more efficient for better rhythm
flaw_data.plain_language: Your shot timing could be more efficient. Work on smooth rhythm from catch to release.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Focus on smooth rhythm from catch to release. Don't rush - let the shot flow naturally.
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Metronome shooting: Practice with consistent rhythm - catch, dip, and shoot with even timing.

flaw_data.description: Follow-through timing could be improved for better consistency
flaw_data.plain_language: Your follow-through timing needs work. Hold your form until the ball reaches the rim for consistent backspin.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Hold your follow-through until the ball hits the rim. Think "reach into the cookie jar."
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Follow-through freeze: Hold your follow-through position for 3 seconds after each shot.

detailed_flaws.description: Advanced analysis detected jerky or rushed shooting motion lacking smooth rhythm
detailed_flaws.remedy_tip: Focus on smooth, rhythmic motion from start to finish. Practice shooting in slow motion to develop muscle memory.
detailed_flaws.exercise_tip: Practice the complete shooting motion without a ball, focusing on fluid movement.
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your shot motion shows jerky movement (fluidity score: 17.8/100). Work on smoother, more rhythmic motion from start to finish.

feedback_points.discrepancy: Elbow extension at release (79.8°) is outside the ideal range (160-180°).

ideal_range.description: Ideal elbow extension at ball release for optimal arc and accuracy

feedback_points.remedy_tips: Focus on fully extending your elbow towards the basket. Imagine reaching into a cookie jar on a high shelf.
